they are priced in traditional Chinese

start with one black silkie chicken
which you can usually find that your
local Asian grocery store they're
typically sold whole so you'll need to
remove the head neck and feet then make
sure to give it a good rinse with cold
water both inside and out next grandma
says to bring a pot of water to a boil
and blanch the chicken for a minute or
two to clean and remove any impurities
now you can always skip the step that
she highly recommends it especially
since it's a soup
once you're done set that aside and we

to three stalks of aged salted turnip
and if you want to know more about

yourself I've got a Q&A with my grandma
at the end of this video

finally add the silkie chicken and a
generous amount of filtered water bring
to a boil cover with a lid then let that
simmer on low for 30 minutes or until
the chicken is done once the dish is
ready serve the soup hot in small bowls
with a piece or two of the silkie
